title: Ekegusii Alphabet, Basic Greetings, and Vocabulary CAT 01 (End of Week 04)
description: This assessment evaluates the learner's knowledge of Ekegusii pronunciation, alphabet, basic vocabulary, greetings, numbering, and early grammar.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about Ekegusii vowels is TRUE?
options: Ekegusii vowels can undergo reduction in unstressed syllables, similar to English.
Ekegusii vowels always retain their full phonetic value regardless of stress.
Ekegusii has seven primary vowels, with distinct nasalized variants.
Ekegusii vowels do not affect meaning when lengthened.
questions.correctAnswer: Ekegusii vowels always retain their full phonetic value regardless of stress.

questions.question: What is the significance of vowel length in Ekegusii?
options: It does not affect word meaning and is purely a stylistic feature.
It determines whether a word is a noun or a verb.
It is phonemically significant and can change the meaning of a word.
It only affects the rhythm of speech but not meaning.
questions.correctAnswer: It is phonemically significant and can change the meaning of a word.

questions.question: Which of the following words exemplifies the use of a consonantal digraph in Ekegusii?
What is a unique feature of Ekegusii consonants compared to English consonants?
options: They rely on vowel harmony for pronunciation.
They include nasalized plosives and palatalized clusters.
questions.correctAnswer: They include nasalized plosives and palatalized clusters.

questions.question: How does the tonal aspect of Ekegusii influence meaning?
options: It primarily affects sentence structure, not word meaning.
It dictates word stress but not pronunciation.
It is crucial in differentiating words that otherwise have identical spelling.
It has no impact on lexical meaning, only on emphasis.
questions.correctAnswer: It is crucial in differentiating words that otherwise have identical spelling.

questions.question: What is a defining characteristic of Ekegusii consonants?
options: They change based on stress in a word.
They include plosives, nasals, and fricatives.
They are silent when placed before vowels.
They always appear at the beginning of words.
questions.correctAnswer: They include plosives, nasals, and fricatives.

questions.question: Speech sounds differ in:
In the word "mogaka," how does tonal variation change its meaning?
Which of the following pronunciation features does NOT contribute to phonological complexity in Ekegusii?
How can a learner best master Ekegusii pronunciation challenges?
options: By avoiding tonal variations to maintain consistency
By memorizing written words without focusing on phonetics
By interacting with native speakers and practicing syllable stress
By replacing Dholuo consonants with their closest English equivalents
questions.correctAnswer: By interacting with native speakers and practicing syllable stress

questions.question: How is the number 17 correctly expressed in Ekegusii?
What is the correct term for 800 in Ekegusii?
Which statement about ordinal numbers in Ekegusii is incorrect?
options: "Oyo" is prefixed to most ordinal numbers.
"Amakwani" is the only ordinal number that does not use "oyo."
"Omokungu o’gatato" means the last in a sequence.
Ordinal numbers are only used in ranking people.
questions.correctAnswer: Ordinal numbers are only used in ranking people.

questions.question: How would one say "The sixth person arrived late" in Ekegusii?
options: Omonto o’gatano na rimo aigete ekero ebiro biarire
Omonto o’gatano achete ekero chingaki chiaerire
questions.correctAnswer: Omonto o’gatano na rimo aigete ekero ebiro biarire

questions.question: If someone refers to "Tichi gatato," which day are they talking about?
In which month would you refer to "Omotienyi o’gatano na rimo"?
What is the correct meaning of "Omokubiol" in Ekegusii?
options: A day when people plant crops

questions.question: Which of the following Ekegusii words refers to "early morning"?
How would one say "twenty" in Ekegusii?
Which of the following phrases is correctly structured in Ekegusii?
Which of the following is NOT part of the four-part day division in Ekegusii?
If an elder refers to "Chiribu kianda," what number are they talking about?
How would one say "the ninth child" in Ekegusii?
What does "Risase’" most closely mean in Ekegusii?
What would be the correct way to say "the third house" in Ekegusii?
